oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Threats of emerging pests due to a warming climate in Finland
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Tuovinen, Tuomo
Lindqvist, Isa
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Crop health, quality, protection
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The total strawberry acreage in Finland (3225 ha, 2008) is almost entirely attributed to outdoor cultivation. The prevailing weather directly influences both the quality and quantity of the yield. An increasing demand for quality berries forces growers to consider cultivation in polythene tunnels. In addition to cultivation changes, new plant protection challenges are also expected to arise as a result of a warming climate.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Tuovinen, Tuomo and Lindqvist, Isa (2009) Threats of emerging pests due to a warming climate in Finland. In: NJF Report, Nordic Association of Agricultural Scientists, 5 (9), NJF Report, p. 6.
